refutes.title: Pure Juice Supplementation: Its Effect on Muscle Recovery and ...
refutes.evidence_summary: The evidence discusses the role of antioxidants from fruit juices in muscle recovery and performance, but it does not specifically mention human growth hormone (HGH) or its relationship to juicing, thus not supporting the claim directly.
refutes.snippet: This review aims to provide a comprehensive overview of nutritional standpoint from previous literature on the effect of fruit juices supplementation on muscle ...

refutes.title: Growth hormone increases muscle mass and strength but does not ...
refutes.evidence_summary: The article discusses the use of synthetic growth hormone (GH) by athletes, noting that while GH is believed to increase strength and muscle mass, it also has severe side effects and is banned by the International Olympic Committee. However, it does not provide evidence that juicing specifically increases GH levels or muscle-building effects.
refutes.snippet: We conclude that GH can increase muscle mass and strength in healthy men over 60 yr old, but does not restore a youthful rate of myofibrillar protein synthesis.
